text: Pours black and opaque with a fizzy tan head; not much lingering or lacing. It has an aroma of malt and chocolate with a taste of coffee, malt and roasted barley with a cocoa and hop finish; mild to moderate bitterness. It¬ís light to medium bodied with little carbonation.

Aroma- caramel, chocolate, coffee, nuts, 
Appereance -black, clear, brown foam, 
Taste- light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, salty, 
Palate- full body, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish,

12 oz bottle. A perfectly balanced beer with many flavors that dance with each other all the way to the bottom of the glass. This is a dark beer with a dark, frothy head. It goes down smoothly with a strong roasty flavor complemented by a great hop bitterness. Simply put, one of the best beers I have drank in 2017.

Opaque dark brown with wood edges. Medium light briwn head. Aroma intensity 4/5. Complex malty aroma, with notes of bread, toast, olive oil, chocolate and seeds. This complexity practically vanishes in the mouth - medium bitter. A bit of a watery texture. Medium body
0,355 l. Bottle. Dark brown color with brown head. Roasted malt and coffee aroma. Coffee, chocolate, fruit and sweet taste. Bitter finish. I love it

I bought this beer in my lovely store beerlovers in one of my favourite city Vienna. I drank it tonight with my wife in Lausanne. The last day of the bottle 06/17, this brewery is as usual good and this beer is a piece of art like the painting of manet. It is a solid oatmeal stout with all the qualities that we could expect, taking a more powerful taste when we drink the last sips, black body color, thin head white and brown, regular carbonation. The taste is with roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, mineral side, hop some oat and malt, dry during all the phases, no comment I could drink liters of this nectar until the last day!!!!

Jet back in colour with brown foam. Aromas of sweet honey, cream and milk along side, oats and cacoa. Palate, medium to full body with creamy palate leaving burned finish. Taste, sweet of oats, and grains followed by cocoa and burned toast. Overall, nice solid beer.

Thanks v&h! Black body, brown head, small. Creamy malty aroma, caramel, berry, light chocolate, dried figs. Clean and nice. Dry light taste, black chocolate and dried figs, light tea/peachy herbal touch. Mild bitter roasty finish and aftertaste. Excellent beer!

bottle @ home
deep dark brown, brown head
dust, milk chocolate, cream, hint of coffee, walnut, ash, roasted chestnut, outmeal cake
dry bitter finish, burned wood, cocoa beans

(From the keg) Dark brown to black beer, with a thin tan-coloured head. An unusual and delicious aroma for a stout: overripe banana, fresh honey, coffee and chocolate in the background, and underlying black treacle. The taste is surprisingly bitter, and leads to an earthy finish. Creamy medium mouthfeel. An unusual, but delicious stout - the aroma isn¬ít balanced as a stout normally is, but pumping up the IBUs makes this little number all the more interesting.

Copenhagen 15/5 2017. 35,5 cl bottle from Skjold Burne. Shakespeare with a stout and a clenched fist on the label. According to the label this is a "World Stout Champion". Pours opaque dark brown with big beige head. Settles as 1,5 cm thick layer of dense foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is intense bitter sweet. Sweet caramel and bitter coffee with notes of nuts, Wood, vanilla and Tobacco. Soft carbonation and surprisingly thin palate. Flavor is sweet - but not overwhelmingly so. Light bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet with notes of bitter coffee. Very easy and pleasant to drink - even though a little thin.
Nose: roasted malt, coffee. Taste: sweetness, roasted / smoke followed by coffee ending in dry soft bitter with coffee ground.

Perfectly drinkable stout, big on dry roastiness, not quite so much on any dark fruits or major chocolate notes. Keeps up a mild coffee acidity that can border on metallic, but the espresso finish and noticeable Rogue yeastiness tighten up the fade. Nose is somewhat lax, but the pour has a nice oily blackness and the brown head leaves modest lacing. Good silky texture. Not a classic but worth an occasional pint or two.
Pours from the black with low brown head, aroma of, aroma is barely present, strong roasted flavors, hopy finish

Bottled 355ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Black coloured, medium sized brown head that stays for a while, chocolate in the nose. Mild roasted malt, chocolate, oats, light coffee and touch of hops with roasty finish and moderate bitterness. All in all good brew.
Klares, sehr dunkles Braun mit reichlich Schaum. R√∂stmalze, etwas dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee, leicht fruchtig, w√ºrzig, leicht herb.
355ml bottle. Black with a nice tan head. Roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Nicely bitter.

Bottle, 355mL. Home. A pitch black beer with a medium beige foamy head ; medium retention. Fruits (blackberry, citrus), roast, light toast, resin, light caramel, coffee note. Light sweet, medium to sharp dry lasting bitter, light spicy. Medium body, oly texture, soft carbonation, very dry bitter lasting finish. Overall, good ! Hoppy Shakespeare feeling : "To be a stout or a black IPA, that is the question !"

@ Budapest, Hungary üëåüèªüëåüèªüëå

www.beeroda.hu - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary üç∫üç∫üç∫ 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/beeroda/

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable tan head. Clear aroma of malt, roast and yeast, with some notes of hops. Bitterish, roasty flavour with notes of malt and yeast and touches of coffee. Hints of lactose. Bitter, roasty aftertaste with estery hints Soft carbonation. Well-balanced and definitely enjoyable. A very decent stout.

1pt 6fl oz bottle poured into an English pint. Black with a tall tan head. Aroma is is roasty dark fruits. Flavor is about the same. Chewy. Lasting bittersweet finish. Pretty good stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Burnt and roasted notes in the nose, medium carbonation and thin lacing that dies quickly. Slight silky smooth coffee, pronounced hoppy bitterness which is quite unique for the style. Right up my street. Very impressive.

Bottle at home. Black colour, brown microfoam with good retention. Nose is chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is medium bitterness. Low metallic taste. Roasted flavours. Fast finish. Nice notes of oatmeal.

Bevuta in bottiglia de 0,33. Buona, ma non da impazzire. Troppo piatta per i miei gusti, tanto che quasi non ha fatto schiuma. Il corpo medio non la rende particolarmente beverina. Aroma e sapore molto piacevoli invece, tipici dello stile e bilanciati.

Pours a very dark brown color. About one finger mocha colored head. Light retention, good lacing.Aroma is bakers chocolate. Some medium roasted coffee. Caramel. Some smokiness.Taste is bakers chocolate. Medium roasted chocolate. Light caramel. Hoppy, light bitter, but leaning sweet.Mouthfeel is medium bodied, but it is thick, rich, and creamy. This is very well rounded.Overall, this is great. Not much to say about it, it¬ís great. I¬íd drink it again, buy it again, and I would recommend it.

W miarƒô ok stout. W aromacie trochƒô czekolada deserowa i du≈ºo kawy zbo≈ºowej. W smaku jest znowu≈º kawa zbo≈ºowa, trochƒô nut palonych. Ko≈Ñc√≥wka jest ewidentnie palona. Lekko kwa≈õnawe od ciemnych s≈Çod√≥w. Raczej wytrawne. Odrobinƒô wodniste. Z ty≈Çu ca≈Çy czas przewija siƒô gorzka czekolada.

Pours black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, oats, fruits. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Roasted finish.

Black. Very malty, with notes of coffee and liquorice, and a strong, almost burned, roasted flavour. Dry taste with a malty bitter and ashy finish. Full body. Overall, a rather decent stout. It has the big, roasted malt profile of an imperial stout but none of the sweetness or alcohol. An interesting approach, but I do not appreciate the charcoal of black malt without some sweetness to complement it.
Draft at Beertemple, Amsterdam. Black with a beige to tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, hint of vanilla. Taste is moderate to heavy bitter, light sweet, roasted bitter aftertaste. Not bad.

Czarne z czerwonymi przeb≈Çyskami. Drobnopƒôcherzykowa be≈ºowa piana ≈Çadnie zdobi szk≈Ço. Aromat czekoladowy, delikatnie s≈Çodki, dla kontry palone s≈Çody z nutƒÖ kawy. W smaku podobnie. Z poczƒÖtku czekolada deserowa, z czasem coraz bardziej wy≈ÇaniajƒÖ siƒô palone s≈Çody i kawa pozostawiajƒÖca przyjemny posmak. Tutaj pojawia siƒô r√≥wnie≈º nieco chmielowej goryczki. Piwo bardzo kremowe, odczucie w ustach ≈õwietnie komponuje siƒô z niskim wysyceniem i przyjemnym posmakiem. Bardzo udany, ciekawy stout

Color negro, con capa de espuma marr√≥n de tres dedos de grosor (r√°pida formaci√≥n de burbujas diminutas, buena retenci√≥n). Carbonataci√≥n m√≠nima. Textura oleosa. Aroma a cacao, malta torrefacta. Sabor a cacao, mucho caf√©, malta torrefacta. Dulce en boca, amago de amargor final. Poco postgusto. Rica.

12 oz bottle. BB 03/2017. From firmabier.com.
Black color with a small grayish light brown head. 
Vanilla, coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, sweetness and mild bitterness in the aroma. Seems to be quite solid. The flavor is roasted malt, bitterness, darkness, coffee, hops and some ashy dryness. 
A bit thinner than I expected.

Bottle. Quite classic stout. Moderately roasty - chocolatey, coffeeish. Oatmeal indeed does add an impression of smoothness in the texture. Otherwise medium-full body, medium carbonation. Mostly roasty malty, other characteristics are in the background. Good one.

Bottle, kindly shared by Gurthnar., many thanks. Dark brown color,with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, citrus hops. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, light nuts. Good.
On tap at Pazzo¬ís. Pours black with ample khaki head. Aroma of toasted malt and some coffee.
Black with a khaki head. Rich, smooth and roasty. I also picked up some coffee character. This was great on a cold night.

15/20 very pleasant stout, nice and smooth not gritty, slight chocolate aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Bought Aug 2011; BBE undated; Drank Dec 2011 - Opaque Jet Black in colour. Sedimented. Very Malty; roasty/burnt malts, oaty, lots of espresso coffee, dark bitter chocolate, liquorice, nuts. Fruity; some slight citrus. Spicy. Hoppy; earthy hops. Bitter very roasty (almost burnt) malty and dry throughout. Very drinkable, but more bitter, less sweet, than the draught version. Lovely Stout! (2011-12-11)
Bottle. Dark brown color with tiny tan head. Aroma - Coffee, wood, oat, chocolate. Taste - Bitter, milk choc, coffee, r-malts, nuts.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 Sehr dunkel, fast schwarz. Brauner Schaum. R√∂stige Malzaromen: Kaffee, Dunkelschokolade. Milder Antrunk. Cremige Textur. Herb im Abgang, sehr viel Kaffee. Insgesamt sch√∂n malzig, dabei nicht zu s√ºss. Nachgeschmack s√º√ülich.

0,33l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, BBD: 08/2017 Pours deep dark borwn to black liquid, small brown head, Aroma: coffe, oats, malty, cherries, wood, chocolate, Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, coffee, chocolate, oats, red fruits, Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, long chcolate oat aftertaste, Overall: very good, very drinkable, medium complexity, enjoyed.

Bottle 0,355L. Black color with a finger of creamy, light brown head. Aroma of dried fruits, dark coffee and a hint of chocolate. Taste starts light bitter with notes of milk chocolate, while finish is medium bitter with a strong coffee touch. Rich and full bodied with creamy texture.

Bottle. Pours brown black with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee, burnt grains, dark chocolate. Bitter-sweet, prominent roasted flavors, coffee, chocolate, charcoal, quite strong herbal bitterness. Medium-bodied, I would prefer more smoothness, but still quite good.

Bottle. Opaque black with brown head. The aroma has notes of milk chocolate, coffee and some roastiness. Sweetish flavor followed by bitterness, lots of roastiness with notes of coffee, a bit creamy and sour, lingering bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied.

Bottle. Pours dark brown-black with thick tan head and lacing. Nose of chocolate with some vanilla and pine notes. Bitterness upfront with pine notes; chocolate in the finish. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - chocolate, barley, and some roast.0
Appearance - the body is black, the head is 2" and light brown, and hangs tight.
Taste - has a nice barley roast, some chocolate, light sugar, and some coffee.
Palate - on the lighter side of full bodied, texture is smooth, carbonation is average the finish is slightly astringent with roast.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Couleur noire, forte mousse beige. Fort nez chocolat√©, cr√©meux, toffee, avec malt grill√©, puissant. Gout de caf√©, grill√©, chocolat noir, bien malt√©, malt grill√©, reglisse bois√©e, intense et rond en bouche. Corps onctueux. Fin bien longue am√®re sur le grill√©, grain de caf√©. Nickel!! une petite bombe!

/ la biererie illkirch
Bottle. Nice enough. Thin grey/brown head. Bit of a coffee taste. Fizzier than the average stout. Ok, but I¬íve had better.

Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma of liquorice and roasted malts. Chocolate, roasted malts, coffee all in the taste and you get some oats coming through as well. Overall a solid beer that is very nice to drink.

(Rogue Shakespeare Oatmeal Stout) Bottle 355ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 6.5%
Black coloured body, one finger of a bit thin, dark brown head on top, with average retention.
Aroma of roasted malts, oats, nougat, dark chocolate.
Taste has oats too, roasted malts, dark bitter chocolate, burnt nuts, light coffee, strong bitterness on the finish.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Very good, especially considering the low ABV.

Zapach intensywny, kawa, palono≈õƒá, czekolada. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana be≈ºowa, niska, drobna, ≈õrednio trwa≈Ça, zdobi szk≈Ço. W smaku wytrawne, ≈õrednia pe≈Çnia, kawa, lukrecja, gorzka czekolada, palono≈õƒá. Goryczka ≈õrednia, wysycenie niskie.
Bottle. Black, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.

Being that I live in Ashland and basically everyone here reps everything Shakespeare I have had this beer many times. I does not disappoint. Its a dark complex stout that I like a lot and served super cold.

Pours ebony with a dark white long lasting top. On tap from Rogue Nation SanFrancisco. Aroma is strong roasted an coffee, some hoppy notes in the back. Full in texture, oily and full tasting. Mild bitterness comes at the end. Very gentle but full beer. An excellwnt choice!

Black colored, medium tan creamy head, nice lacing, long lasting. Aroma is of chocolate, light caramel, bit nutty aroma, roasted malt, some coffee. Taste is medium sweet milk chocolate, bit nutty, light caramel, roasted malt with coffee, medium bitter roasted dry finish, decent bitterness, lasting dark choco aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, nice n creamy. Excellent.
(bottle, Pivoljub Ljubljana)

(35 cl bottle from Kervan¬ís; BBD: August 4th 2018) Poured at fridge temperature into To √òl teku reveals a black body with one finger of tan head that recedes somewhat. Nice lace. Aroma has notes of licorice and roasted malt. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body and a lingering, roasted and slightly ascerbic finish. Flavour does not hold much sweetness but is rather dry and roasted akin to an Irish Dry Stout although this one probably has a bit more salt licorice. Decent and drinkable.
Black colour, beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate. Taste is light sweet, slightly bitter. A bit of smoked flavour. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Aroma: Chocolate, coffee, molasses Appearance: Dark brown, red glow, soft can, beige medium bubble foam, staying head, full lace Taste: Chocolate, coffee, light bitterness and sourness, medium body, roast, malts, light bitter thin finish

1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, Moor tap takeover. Nose is roasty. Body is black, head is big, brownish, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is tobacco, smoked wood, dark chocolate, roasted malt, spices, ash. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty and hoppy medium to heavy bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessertish beer, very unique, very tasty, such a strong flavor with this ABV is amazing, great one.

La birra √® di colore nero profondo, che lascia poco spazio alla luce; la schiuma √® abbondante, compatta, di colore marroncino, dalla buona allacciatura e di ottima persistenza. Buonissima intensit√† al naso: il malto tostato dona uno straordinario aroma di cioccolato con essenza di caff√®, mentre la ricchezza degli zuccheri e l¬íoscurit√† della birra, portano alla mente la dolcezza della melassa. Non √® una presenza schiacciante, ma √® evidente la discreta quantit√† di luppolo utilizzato. Tutto insieme una buona complessit√† olfattiva. In bocca conferma le sensazioni nasali, risultando corposa e di buon carattere: un ricco sapore di malto tostato, a seguire cioccolato, con un pizzico di caff√®; fino a lasciare il posto ad un buon amaro da luppolo, ottimamente bilanciato dalla dolcezza dell¬íavena utilizzata per la creazione di questa Shakespeare.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Shakespeare Oatmeal Stout by Rogue Ales & Spirits at Powi≈õleNie czuje platkow, malo ciala. Ale fajnie kawowo palono czekoladowe, wytrawne, cos jakby lukrecja czy anyzek w tle? Kwaskowe posmaki.ok+Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Looks like a million bucks. Deep opaque reddish brown with cookies and cream milkshake head. Coffee, soy sauce (props to below), licorice, toasted malts on nose. Chocolate, coffee (tastes like roasted coffee smells), oats, roasted barley. Lighter mouthfeel with creamy texture. Lingering finish with coffee bitterness. Very, very nice.

0,33l bottle at home. BB 03/2017. black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells of licorice, earthy, hazelnuts, some coffee, bitter chocolate. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, some licorice, coffee roasty, some charcoal, some vanilla, some spices. finishes lightly roasty with notes of vanilla, spices and some earthy notes. decent one, gets a bit thin towards the finish. overall quite good one though.

Bottle. Black in colour, small beige head. Aroma of dark bitter chocolate, espresso, some licorice and hint of pine. In taste lightly sweet, dry with roastiness, coffee, dark chocolate notes. Medium to light body, soft carbonation, creamy texture, finish os bitter. Tasty stout.
on tap at City Tap House in University City - nice dark color. Sweet chocolatey aroma and flavor. Very good.

35.5cl bottle split with SimonBlok, cheers for that. Pours a colour as black as my ex-girlfriends soul with a decent beige head which diminishes to a even thin layer. Aroma of oatmeal, soy sauce, caramel, coffee beans. Taste is fairly sweet, medi bitter with a dry bitter finish. Notes of caramel, coffee, peated malts, chocolate. Texture is oily to sticky, medium to full bodied with decent carbonation.

35,5cl bottle split with Gyhallmanti. Appearance: dark with low khaki head. Aroma: very roasty, oatmeal, roasted and peated malts, peanuts. Taste: medium sweetness and fairly high bitterness. Notes of roasted and peated malts, coffee, cacao, Finish is dry bitterish with coffee. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation.
Black with thin head. Aroma and flavour have plenty of roasted malt. Really well balanced. Bitter. Smooth. Easy to drink.
On nitro draft. Poured a beautiful jet-black with a beige-colored head that lasted for days. Super smooth, mellow drink with lingering coffee, chocolate, and cigar notes.
Draft. It poured black with a nice tan head. It had notes of chocolate and light coffee. Very nice.

Bottle, 0.355l. Pitch black color with medium creamy light brown head and poor lacing. Aroma of oats, roasted malt, coffee, caramel and chocolate. Taste starts with moderate sweet malt and oats, follows by dry coffee, chocolate and licorice, mouthfeel is rich and smooth, while finish is mild bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Liquid poetry in motion...
Beatiful thick, dark coloured stout. Thick white creamy head. Convenient bitters, chocolate, dried bread, couple of nuts and coffee in taste and nose.
355 ml bottle from Boxbeers. Pours black with beigebrownish head. Aroma of chocolate, hazelnut, nougat, coffee, oats, roasted malts. Creamy mouthfeel, roasted bittered flavours.

Piana be≈ºowa, niedu≈ºa, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa czarna jak smo≈Ça, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat gorzkiej czekolady, kawy espresso, lukrecji - intensywny, przyjemny. W smaku do≈õƒá wytrawne, palone, kakaowe, truflowe, kawowe, wyra≈∫nie gorzkie. Jest te≈º delikatna wanilia w aftertejsie. W odczuciu lekko szorstkie, cierpkie, ≈õrednio wysycone grubymi bƒÖblami, do≈õƒá rzadkie, ale tre≈õciwe.
ZaskakujƒÖce, ≈ºe wodniste w swej strukturze piwo mo≈ºe byƒá tak pe≈Çne smaku i zapachu. Nie wiem, czy to jakie≈õ sztuczne dodatki (jak ekstrakt z orzech√≥w w ich Hazelnut Brown Nectar) czy nie, ale dobrze siƒô to pije.

35,5 cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured black as a moonless night with a three finger mocha tan head. Wonderful aroma of: dark chocolate, roasted malts, dark fruit, vanilla, licorice, roasted coffee beans, caramel. Taste: dark chocolate, vanilla, dark roasted espresso beans, burnt toffee, dark fruit, licorice, hoppy bitterness, roasted nuts, caramel, haagse hopjes (Dutch caramel/coffee treats), marshmallows, whole wheat currant bread, raisins. Thick & bready roasted mouthfeel. Oatmeal gives the beer its extra ¬íchunk¬í. Medium to full body with a very roasted bittersweet finish. Absolutely delicious stout.

This was an introductory stout for me, several years ago when I first started enjoying beers. At first, it was something similar to my normal go to at the time. Now, it¬ís a classic that I will always remember as one of the beers that really got me into the craft. It¬ís cool to see such an old school stout that has remained the same for so long, and see it stand up to all the great stouts that come and go whole it lives on. I don¬ít know how I never rated this before, but I¬ím glad I didnt. I feel like I¬ím ready to give it the proper recognition it deserves. Nitro pour at the Collective. Cola black pour with an infinite tan cream cap. Toasty malt aroma provides the invitation. Flavor is a roasted malt, sweetened by a rich milk chocolate and subtle dryness. Oat like sweetness, as expected. Model beer to be presented on nitro. I still think they rule the chocolate in beer world. I can¬ít quite call this up to the Double Chocolate curve, but this beer is a solid stout that will always be there for you. This stout is timeless.
Aarde en stro eerst, dan espresso.. droog, bitterig, redelijj goeie balans... donkere afdronk... beetje room... lekkere complexe stout

Bottle 12 Oz. Pours black with small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, hint of coffee. Taste is coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, oat, wood, mild bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation.

330ml bottle. Thick brown pour with a thin mocha head. Aroma of roasted malt infused with alcohol, slight vanilla, and dark chocolate. The flavour is dark, with tarred woodsmoke and mellow roast giving way to a creaminess on the finish.
330ml bottle at beer meats grill. Subtle nose with hints of malt and chocolate. Small body which packs a lot of flavour. Rich finish which is almost sweet.

Pours dark with two fingers tanned head 
Aromas of milk chocolate, oatmeal, hazelnut, nougats, hints of coffee, caramel 
Taste has notes of caramel, chocolate, coffee, brown sugar, dark bread, 
Mouthfeel is creamy, medium bodied, medium carbonation, low bitterness, medium sweetness

zwart met fijne bruine kraag. aroma van chocolade, geroosterde mout, haver, melkchocolade, vanille, gebrande mout, lichte koffie. Smaken redelijk tot stevig bitter, poeder achtige cacao, droog, donkere chocolade, geroosterde/gebrande mouten, enorm droog, lang bittere afdronk. aroma was over het algemeen beter dan de smaak.

Coffee, chocolate, oat and roastiness in aroma. Pours black with beige head. Taste is medium sweet with chocolate, oat, coffee and citrus. Low to medium bitterness at the finish. Overall very good and smooth stout.

The aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel and sweetness. Dark coffee, dark chocolate, soy and licorice taste. Lovely bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. Enjoyment is the word for this beer. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle at work. Pours nearly Black with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, roast, light ash, creamy, caramel. Taste is rather sweet, light hops. Coffee, light choko, light hop, light pine. Dry roasty finish.
Uit de fles geschonken. Pikzwart bier. Aromas van geroosterde mout en gedroogd fruit. Smaken van geroosterde mout, gedroogd fruit, hop en chocola in de afdronk. Mooie volle en complexe stout

sample at mondial de la bi√®re, mtl. unclear dark brown with a very nice creamy crema head, good retention and lacing. creamy chocolate maltiness, lightly spicy and piney hops, dense burnt melon fruitiness, touch of burnt caramel and pecans, (hot) milk chocolate powder, silky oatmeal, never metallic. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; balanced chocolatey-spicy finish. very good oatmeal stout.
pour black with a fine off white head. coffee, coal, nutty, aromas. medium bitterness, sweet notes. full bodied. average carbonation.

Pours jet black with minimal head. Aroma of coffee, bitter chocolate and boiled peanuts. Flavour not as full as the aroma but very rich and enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Eriksen Vinhandel. Clear dark brown/black with a brown head. Aroma medium malty (roasted, burnt, chocolate, oats). Flavor light sweet, medium bitter, chocolate, dry. Thin body.

12oz bottle new arrival at Bierhandlung bb04/2017. - (First sampled at Braukunst LIve 2013). - Fresh and precisely composed Dry/Oatmeal Stout with rich textured malts and a manageable hop bitter bite with character. A Top 50/World Class Stout I can live with. - * Earthy, tobacco-leaf dryness from the roast and Cascades quench thirst in lovely harmony, making this so much more and easier to drink than a winter warmer. * Lets roast nuts, coffee grounds and bitter chocolate powder hover over a hidden Cascade ale. * Deals mainly in dry bitters and does well as coffee spice in a sweet vanilla ice cream float. * Glad to revisit.
Black with brown head. Roasted aroma, hints of coffee. Flavour has some sweetness, roasted malt and chocolate. Finishes dry and bitter.

355 ml bottle into pint. Served at room temperature. Smells of chocolate pudding, toffee, cocoa and oats. Blacker than ebony with a tan-coloured head. Surprisingly effervescent with a full body. Finish starts fruity moving to dry cocoa then dark chocolate. Very pleasant winter beer.

1 Pint 6 Fl Oz/650 ml bought from the Issaquah Brewery poured to wine glass	
A: Black, medium brown head that slowly disappears, some lacing	
Smell: Aroma of licorice, fragrant
Taste medium, low bitterness	
very good beer, good to repeat
Drank: June 1, 2016

shared bottle from local bottle shop. deep black pour with a creamy head. nose of sweet caramel, oats, milk chocolate, prunes, slight licorice, ashy, sweet chocolate. taste is somewhat light bodied compared to other low abv stout. sweet. slight sticky. ok

Pours pitch black with a thick dark brown-cappuccino head.

Lots and lots of coffe both in aroma and taste, maybe even too much as it tends to mask everything else.
Full body, medium-low carbonation, one of the most bitter stout I tried also, but very drinkable. Taste is not what I¬íd say exceptional, but I had to hinder myself from drink it all at once anyway.

Had a lot of expectations from this beer, most not met honestly, but it¬ís far from being bad.
Sure will drink again as I think this was some kind of an unlucky bottle.
Pours black with a cocoa head. aroma is strong roasted malts & porridge. Taste is an earthy, roasted porridge flavour with honey. Lovely.

pours black color, clear, with creamy stable light brown/brown head. Aroma: intense malt aroma, which takes on toffee, chocolate, with hint of cocoa, supported with hop aroma, which takes on citruses, with some spicy undertones. Flavor are practically the same as aroma finish is slighty sticky dry-bitter, and lingers long in aftertaste. Body is medium, texture silky soft, carbonation is low.

Bottle at home. Aroma is oats, roasted malt, chocolate, big coffee, mocha, fruity hoppy notes. Flavour is medium bitter with a touch of sweetness. Body is above medium and a bit creamy. Very tasty coffee chocolate fruity hoppy Oatmeal Stout.

Bottle 35cl / Botella 35cl.
@ Aeon Mall Nagoya Dome Mae, Nagoya, Japon.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, coffee / Malta tostada, caramel, chocolate, cafe.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, dried fruit, liquorice, chocolate, bread, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dried fruit, liquorice and chocolate; ends slightly bitter with bread, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Really great for its abv and has an amazing creamy palate. The aroma could have been stronger and the palate thicker. Does not have a usp, but excels at everything.
Bottle from Safeway in Redwood City, CA. Super creamy with a nice chocolate smoothness. An exemplary oatmeal stout.
Lightly peated aroma with chocolate & coffee. Black with brown head. Dry taste with a bitter finish. Medium body & average carbonation.
From bottle. Pours with medium tan head. Drinks with roasty taste and a little bitterness

Scent in the nostiles is roasted barley and chili¬ís. Deep rich black color. Smooth taste of the roasted barley with hints of choco through out the Flavor profile. Full body brew with beautiful carbonation for this stout. Smooth though out the taste and feel. I would have to give this one of the nicest full body oatmeal stouts I¬íve drinking to date. This will be my recomended oatmeal stout two thumbs up on this brew. Nice work Rouge.

Almost black in color with a three finger tan foamy head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, oats some coffee and slight hops. Taste is bitter with a predominant roasted oats taste balanced by coffee-chocolate notes. Wish the taste of oats would be predominant. Other than that, a drinkable stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 12 oz. bottle from Liquor Barn (Jefferson Commons). Aroma: Rich milk chocolate with caramel chewy candy, light waffle cone and a very light vinous quality. Appearance: Dark garnet black pour with a sticky tan head that settles into a thick, messy ring. Flavor: Chocolate and light oats up front with roasted notes coming in thereafter, leading to a mostly dry, lightly bitter finish. Palate: Light body, slick texture, very soft carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: Smells and looks nice, but fell short for me with regards to taste and mouthfeel. Still, one could do much worse than this craft beer classic.

the aroma of caramel, black chocolate, toast, toffee, robust and vanilla... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of roasted malt, toffee, toast, coffee and cocoa... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

Deep rich colour bordering on black. Tan foamy head. Almost no aroma. Great malty oat taste. Bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown creamy weak head. Dark brown colour. aroma is malty with dark chocolate, dark fruits and licorice notes. Flavor is malty too with bread and prunes and dark chocolate tones, ending in a roasty and moderately fruity finish. Medium bodied.

330 ml bottle into a pint glass.Pours black, with a good sized tan head. Nose is burnt coffee and chocolate. Taste is dark roast malt and coffee. Some hop bitterness on the finish to counter the creamy mouth feel. Pretty nice.

Originally rated on 8/8/08.A dark black body that doesnt let any light though, a thin dark tan cap, that left minimal lacing. Aromas a plenty- oak, mocha, chocolate, and roasted nuts. All those also come through in the taste as well as oats,a nd a little smoke, with a nice bitter bite at the end. Creamy and smooth, excellent balance with this stout.
355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours black with an off white head. Aroma of hops with chocolate and roast. Dry bitter finish.
Bottle(6-Mar-16)Light roast malt aroma.Black,brown head&sheet lace.Smoke malt herbal flavour.Bitter roast herb finish&smoke malt veg aftertaste.
Malt chocolate aroma. Dark brown colour with great head and lacing. Malt chocolate flavour. Smooth palate.

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a deep black color forming a medium creamy tan head with medum retention and lots of lingering lacings left in the glass. Strong notes of dark chocolate, coffee and mainly roasted malts in the nose. Sligtly sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Licorice and grass. Good bitterness. Grassy hops profile. Medium to heavy body. Medium carbonaton. Dark chocolate and roasted malts in the aftertaste. Persistent. Good drinkability. Classic Oatmeal Stout.

Large bottle ! who the hell can really appreciate the nuances in a little 355ml bottle? . I¬íve not drunk this beer in ten years and liked it then ,but neglected to write a bunch of crap down for dissection! I approach US lower boost Stouts with mild unease as too many of them in my experience are a boxing match of roast and rich hops .... this beer isn¬ít like that . nice balance offered . roast bitter malt dryness , coffee notes are rich enough ...only subtle oat textures. the hoppy vibes are floral but relaxed , this ain¬ít trying to be a Black IPA . huuge ass beiged head rests greatly over brooding blackness .... I drank the second half of the bottle fast as hell!

Bottle to shaker glass, pours near black. Two finger pillow dark tan head. Nice lacing with small cap retention. Aroma of coffee. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter. Full bodied, moderate carbonation, creamy mouth feel. Finishes long. Tasting notes of oats, coffee, dark chocolate, dark roasted barley and earth. Simple and on the spot, text book oatmeal stout. Very good.

Bottle from Bottle Baron. Deep brown/black body with a medium tan head. Aroma of shoe polish, dark chocolate, burnt coffee, digestive biscuits and earth. Flavour of orange, ash, backcurrant and cigar. Medium body with a smooth, creamy texture. Light fizz. A classy beer that packs a lot of complexity into 6.0% ABV. Straddles the line between Stout and Black IPA.

black color
aroma is weak, smells like coffe and hint of caramel
flavor of chocolate, malty and dry finish
bitter

roasty, toast, brown, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, bitter. Delicious roasted nuts, burnt toast aroma. Lightly sweet on the lips, briefly sour, extended bitter finish. Brings to mind burnt coffee beans. Competent for what it is, but far to acrid for my taste.

Nitro pour at engine 15, Jacksonville Beach. Pours dark brown/black with an off white head. Not much of an aroma, a little milk choc. Thin, watery body. Light carbonation. It's dry with some bitter choc and coffee. Light licorice too. Dull stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Almost black, inkdark, moderate tan to brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, earth, oats, a bit vinous. Medium body. Oily. Dry taste with notes similar to the nose. Proper medium bitterness. Good-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle @ home. marrone opalescente. schiuma beige fine e persistente.aroma complesso, fave di cacao, caff√® in polvere, vaniglia, lieve fruttato agumato da luppolo. amara, , secca, acidula, con note di cacao, crosta di pane, ed erbaceo da luppolo. Poco calda, corposa, carbonatazione debole. spigolosa, Equilibrata ed armonica.

355ml bottle @ The Dog & Doublet, Wolverhampton. Pours very dark brown with good tan head. Aroma is roast & choccy. Taste is big in roast and smooth chocolate with a creamy oatmeal texture and comforting deep flavour. Very good.

Dark pour, creamy head. Lots of burnt coffee beans, smooth, although a little thin, with a floral hoppy finish. Not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle for Christmas present thanks to s_Hartshorne, cheers Shane. Black beer with large tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and little chocolate. Taste is roasted malts, some bitter coffee and chocolate. Some creaminess in body. Solid.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Rated from old notes. Dark, creamy, rich, deeply roasted, heavy with an almost acrid bitterness in the aftertaste. Did not think I would like this at the outset, but it does grow on you.
Expected more...this one had more coffee notes than oatmeal and chocolate...a tad bitter...just ok
Dark brown almost black with big mocha head. Bitter hop smell with a little dark chocolate. And that¬ís pretty much the taste as well with some roasted malt. Not a bad stout.
Marrom, opaca. Espuma abundante e persistente. Aroma de chocolate e caf√©, que acompanha o sabor, adocicado, com fortes notas de defumado e um pouco de melado. Retrogosto levemente √°cido e defumado.
Pours a jet black with serious lacing. Aroma of sweet chocolate and roasted nut. Taste is smooth thanks to the nitro and bitter due to coffee not hops.

Tap at Tap Bar in MGM, 11th November 15. This pours black, fairly thick. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, smoke, Taste is creamy chocolate, coffee, roasty wholesome malts, vanilla. Really smooth and great to drink

Bottle tall boys beer market Leeds. Black ok tan head. Aroma is chocolate roast malts taste is same nice creaminess some fruits good sweetness nice roasty smoke good bitter finish great balance. Nice mouthdeel slight carbonation. Good stuff tasty.

Dark-ety, dark dark. But the flavour is actually somehow refreshing. Molasses and dark dark chocolate with a hint of spice. I can't pinpoint where the balancing near citrus kind of zip comes from, but it works.

Poured from the bottle into a tulip glass to drink. The beer had a thick black color with a medium-sized creamy dark tan head with modest retention, but very good cling and lacing. Its aroma features roasty chocolate, molasses, and some toffee with a bit of earthy and grainy hops as well. The taste had a great malty chocolate sweetness along with molasses, coffee, and some grainy and earthy hops blended throughout. The body was watery with a filling mouthfeel and was a touch creamy and wet with good carbonation.
Overall a very good stout. Just a bit bitter to my taste. I prefer a sweet end. Appearance and palate definitely carry this one.

Cellared away for a good two and a half years - well forgotten about to be honest. Into a snifter at just on cool. Black as night and opaque with a steady tan foam. Vegemite, Bovril, peppered Biltong, anchovy, a veritable feast of umami for a nose. Not one for modern text language but OMG! This is silky, velvety and full in body. Big hit of dark chocolate offers plenty of ground for some vinous, peppery notes, ash and charred wood, umami, grilled meat, earth and a tad of bitter/sweet treacle. Roasted malts a plenty. This is a great Stout. Really enjoyed it! (65cL, BB 01/02/14, ?)

Una birra che si presenta di un colore ebano scuro, tendente al nero, impenetrabile con una bel cappello di schiuma color nocciola, abbondante, molto pannoso e dalla lunghissima persistenza. Al naso sentori tostati (caff√®), di cioccolato e una lieve nota di tabacco fanno da cornice al cereale. Al palato ti accorgi subito della sua morbidezza, con carbonazione media e un corpo discretamente strutturato. In bocca ritroviamo le note tostate e maltare, prive di altri sentori, che sul finale diventano pi√π amare. Deglutendola si avverte l¬íamaro, molto delicato, tendente al resinoso, che si lascia ad una buona e leggiadra persistenza. Ottima la facilit√† di bevuta.

Tap on nitro at rogue PDX airport. Rich roasted malt aroma with chocolate and some earthy notes. Pours black with a creamy light brown head with excellent retention and lacing. Starts with rich roasted malt flavors and a hint of chocolate with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel and full body. Finishes quite smooth with the aforementioned flavors with a little bit of earthy hoppiness. Very nice stout.
Keg at Ushers. Pours dark brown. Nose is soft gentle hops, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is hoppy, citrus, roasted malts, sour coffee.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 Botrle @ Elfo¬ís Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a pitch black colour, very small white head. Quite malty, with notes of coffe and chocolate. Medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation.

Pite na wyje≈∫dzie z butelki. Mocny zapach kawowo-czekoladowy z palono≈õciƒÖ w tle. W smaku gorzka czekolada i kawa zbo≈ºowa, kawowa kwa≈õno≈õƒá, palona goryczka. Smak g≈Çƒôboki i wielowymiarowy, dobry balans.
Black velvety pour with creamy tan froth atop. Roasted malts, bitter coffee, mild chocolate, hop bitterness. Good stuff, and great body for the ABV.

Pours a black from a tap. Nitro head like a moussey froth. Not much going on here, sweet milk stout. Abit of smoke. Meh.

Cask at GBBF 2015, Olympia, London. A black coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, chocolate, slightly sweet. Nice stout but keg would have improved it.

Cask at GBBF 2015. It pours near black with a small light tan head. The nose is soft, bitter-sweet, rich chocolate, coffee, fudge cake and icing sugar. The taste is rich, bitter-sweet, oily, cocoa, toasty, coffee grounds, earthy roast, mild acidity, umami and liquorice with a dry, toasty finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Works pretty well on cask. Smooth and easy-going, but not a whole lot to it. Pretty enjoyable anyhow.

[cask, at the Great British Beer Festival 2015] - Rogue Ales and Spirits, Oregon, Shakespeare Stout, 5.8%. Dark brown, no head. Slightly sweetish aroma of vanilla chocoalte and mild coffee, oatmeal. Medium body, a bit watery still. Dark chocolate, licorice, vanilla and roasted malts at the start. Espresso in the middle, very bitter and the bitterness even increases in the finish. Really bitter espresso finish, with a bitter and sour coffee aftertaste. And that¬ís how they do it.

{from notes} 
Appearance: Dark brown/black pour, with a modest light brown head that all too quickly reduced to a thin and spotty cover. 

Smell: Medium + dark roasted malts overlaid with some spicy hops. Some oats, coffee and chocolate too. 

Taste: It seems that the brewer replaced some grains (oats and/or dark malts) with hops; this is clearly an AMERICAN stout. It has a moderately bitter finish, with a relatively bitter and near-burnt aftertaste. 

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body with mild carbonation. Has an unusual (for style) light crispness.

Overall: A decent oatmeal stout, but disappointing for a stout made by Rogue. Certainly served too cold and deserving of a re-tasting. I know you feel my pain. ;)

An old fav. Silky with light finesse and some end acidity, there is smooth rich dark chocolate and a lightness of touch. Old schoolish in style and interesting reminder of what the early American craft beer was like before everything went extreme.

Cask gravity at GBBF 2015 day 1. Dark brown coloured pour with a lasting creamy light tan head. Aroma is toast, earthy mineral, charred wood, oyster. Flavour is composed of milky dark choc, earthy, dirt, oats and woody, little coconut character. Palate is medium, velvety. Smooth and medium bodied. Lingering woof and smooth roast.

Thick & black with a creamy tan head that lasts all the way down. Textbook stout flavours... roasted malts, chocolate, hint of coffee, slight smoke. Light bitter finish, perfect sweetness. Nothing to complain about at all. Spot on.
Very roasted character with notes of especially Coffee, dark, and some Milk, chocolate , bitter oats and a bit of hops. A bit thin for My taste - good stuff though
Bottle. Almost black. Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate and coffee with a hint of hops. Taste has the same shades, light sweetness, good texture.

22 July 2015, tap at Rogue Ales in Portland Airport. black. nose is bitter dark chocolate malt and burnt toast. med, creamy body and mildly fizzy. really has a very burnt toast taste, slightly sweet dark chocolate. very nice.

Certainly a proper stout, and among the better beers I¬íve had from Rogue. Coffee and sharp oat with big roast. Pours jet black with mocha head and lacing. Medium bitter finish. Thick oily texture. Bottle.
Keg at the bow bar. Pours black, nose is sweet chocolate, cacao, toffee, taste is similar, very sweet.

Pours black with a caramel head that is nice and dense. Nice mouth feel as you would expect from an oatmeal stout, along with a charcoal and sweet malt mid palate. Smoky chocolate finish that lingers. Only truly reveals its oatmeal origins right at the very end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap. Black color with light beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, light coffee, hoppy too. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Poured from a 500mL bottle. Appearance is dark chocolate black, huge head. Aroma is heavy tobacco, vanilla bean extract. Taste is earthy and oatmeal, with milky taste. Palate is medium bodied and semi-creamy. Overall, its pretty darn good but you already knew that.

Draught @ Stag¬ís Head. Inky black with small creamy beige head, faint coffee aroma, low carbonation, bitter coffee beans taste, long bitter finish. I missed the chocolate aftertaste, feeling just the bitterness. Very good stout, simple and straightforward.

Black pour..no light, just black. Small toffee colored head. Nose is coffee and coco nibs. Bittersweet. Middle is unsweetened coco, huge dark roasted malt backbone,charred wood. Finish is dry. This is better than chocolate chip cookies right out of the oven.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 Black with medium brown head. Full bodied, aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Smooth bitter finish. Very enjoyable.

Opaque black with a nice mocha head. Aroma is licorice with some Cocoa and plums. Flavor is dark chocolate with a slight touch of raisins and an espresso bitter finish with some citric hops. Great silky medium palate, interesting and really enjoyable
Draft - Black as night with a thick head that sticks around for a while. The head is a malty brown in color. Roasted malt flavor, slightly nutty.

Bottle; pours nearly black with a thin mocha head; aroma is chocolate and oats with hints of vanilla and coffee; taste is coffee, roasted malts, a little chocolate with some hints of vanilla and oats; has a dry coffee finish with very little bitterness; very nice stout

The aroma is wonderful, honey, blossom, rich sweet malt. The interplay of cascade and the chocolate malts creates a lovely floral nose. Taste is rich, chocolatey with some bitterness from the dark malts but not overpowering. Head is initially tan but fades to cream and dissipates somewhat. Long finish and smooth mouthfeel. Full bodied and very satisfying. A cracking beer.
On nitro at craven Road. Dark brown with brown head,aroma of Coffee, chocolate and nut. The flavour is the same with thin body e light tessiture. Good harmony,enjoy to drink it.

I bit to much bitter at the start of the taste for me to really enjoy the stout aspect of this beer. It does have a nice taste and smoother taste at the back end, yet it still lacks that full body flavor. Pours black. slight head.

Bottle from the Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Pours dark brown, almost black with a tan head. Nice cocoa aroma. The taste is biteer with light spice and flavours of coffee and chocolate. Moderate carbonation giving creamy mouth feel. Very good

This is a decent stout but I must say, I found it a little disappointing. It has some nice chocolate flavors but lacks the body and complexity that I'd hoped for and have found in other oatmeal stouts. I didn't pour it out, but I'd probably not get it again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 355 ml bottle. Pours a solid inky black with a small but lasting brown head. Aromas of raisins, dates, cherries, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is rich coffee and dark fruit at the start before a firm roast bitterness in the mid-palate followed by light chocolate and vanilla notes at the end. Gentle milk chocolate aftertaste. Lovely full body with a smooth mouthfeel. Great stuff.
650 ml bottle poured at a friends house. Pours black as night and tastes of a nice strong malt. Little bit of carbonation. Good drink. I¬íll have another!
Wonderful oatmeal stout that is very dark and has a nice tan head. This is good for the winter time and the oatmeal gives it a nice complete taste.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 W aromacie trochƒô owsianki, czekolady, ciemne s≈Çody. Czarny, perfekcyjna piana. Bardzo, bardzo kremowy, g≈Çadki i aksamitny. W smaku delikatna kawa. Lekka kwasowo≈õƒá w posmaku. Troszkƒô ma≈Ço cia≈Ça. /edit/ Second try - tap in Rogue Ales Public House - San Francisco. Black color, tanned head, perfect one, completely steady, persistent. Very little aroma. Hard to notice anything. There¬ís a little bit of oats and cocoa. In taste it¬ís a bit better. Some coffee is noticeable, some oats. It¬ís pleasantly good but was hoping for so much more. Thin in the mouth, was expecting a bit of thickness.

Yeah....this is a good standard chocolaty stout, but definitely not the "Best in the World". Taste to me pretty much like their chocolate stout, with a bit more of a hoppy kick. I think I prefer Rogue¬ís Chocolate Stout slightly better. Only tried them both once...about a year ago, so reviewing this by memory. There are many other similar stouts that sell in 6-packs for way less than this. Not bad to try something new in the Rogue family though. Medium thickess for a stout, not super-heavy. Dark appearance with a mocha-tan head. A very good overall beer, just one of those "Been there, done thats".

Piwo butelkowe w pubie The Horatia. Dla mnie bomba, ≈õwietny stout, tylko najpierw musia≈Çem go ogrzaƒá w d≈Çoniach bo butelka by≈Ça prosto z lod√≥wki. Bardzo ciekawy zapach, taka kombinacja wanilii, kawy, likieru i chmielu. Smak to mocno palona kawa, gorzka czekolada, s≈Çodki likier i jednocze≈õnie wysoki poziom goryczki. Nie by≈Ç a≈º tak "g≈Çadki" od p≈Çatk√≥w owsianych jak my≈õla≈Çem, ale dziƒôki nim Rogue jest bardziej pe≈Çny w smaku. Bardzo dobre piwo.
Bottle. Rich roast, liquorice and a bitter hoppy bite. Creamy and smooth body. A high quality beer.
shared bottle poured into a tulip glass..dark with a fluffy tan head..aroma of coffee,roasted nuts,milk,chocolate..creamy,smooth and hoppier than i expected..good offering.

It's a nice crisp stout, got a lot of chocolates and toffee flavours. Really well balanced, it's got a lightness that I wasn't expecting, rather refreshing in comparison to the heavier usual style. Really nice stuff!

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2015 Black with a medium beige head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, toffee, earthy and floral notes. Taste is toasted malt, coffee, cocoa, some smoked notes, earthy bitterness, syrup sweetness, light sourness. Bitter toasty and earthy aftertaste. Great Stout!
On tap at Rogue, San Francisco. Pours black with tan Nitro head. Aroma is roasted chocolate and coffee. Flavor is coffee and chocolate. Not very substantial mouthfeel.

Handpump @Buskers Pub (Rome). Deep black, unclear, massive beige foam. Aroma is nuts, chocolate, alcol, coffee notes and liquorice, so intense. Flavour is powerful, chocolate, coffee with liquorice and bitter end. Medium to high body, flat, rich. Very good!
40cl @ Tap. Oatmeal stout con una bella schiuma bianca, sentori di caff√© e cioccolato, finale molto amaro.

On nitro. Deep black color, beautiful rich tan head. Good thick lacing. Extremely smooth creamy texture, with flavors of roasted malts balanced by some hop bitterness at the end. Texture is the thing. Not an amazing palate.
This was the first Rogue beer I tasted and its a good stout but no more. It¬ís quite plain and not complicated

Appearance is pretty much pitch black, values hint of brown around the edges. A half-finger brown/tan head which doesn¬ít last long. Aroma- milk chocolate, dark malts, slight roast, coffee, vanilla, brown sugar. Taste- dry roasty notes hit first, bitter chocolate, cold coffee, roast dark malts, quite full and a bit creamy in the mouth, roasty, bitter finish slightly reminiscent of burnt toast, with a hint of vanilla. Nice stout.

On tap at Popeye in Tokyo. Served in a shaker half pint. Sorghum black color with a nice toasted marshmallow colored foamy head. Roasted coffee and sweet malty and chocolate aroma. Creamy mouthfeel and finish. Well-balanced malt toastiness and hop bitterness. Long aftertaste with hints of chocolate.

strong chocolate and oatmeal flavor to start with a bitter milky finish. smells chocolaty with a soft silky feel in the mouth. lots of sediment in the bottle and the glass. had a bomber pour at home. decent stout.

Total black beer with a small and fast dissapearing brown head.

Nose: Coffee, dark chocolate, candy, vanilla and roasted malt.
Taste: Coffe from arabic beans, dark chocolate, rich roasted malt, chocolate milk, sweet syrup and some hops.
Body: Medium to full body with light carbonation. A great bitterness. Creamy.

Pitch black with a smallish tan head. The smell is sweet - marshmallows, jelly beans, sugar cookies with a little floral hint. The taste doesn¬ít follow the nose like I had expected. It¬ís thick in the mouth. The floral essence hits first and then follows with a dark roasty flavor. Not as sweet as I had expected, which is probably a good thing considering how sweet the smell was. Really good beer.

Tastes of oatmeal, toast, roasted malt and coffee. Full bodied and smooth texture. Roasted bitterness in the finish. A smooth, strong stout but doesn¬ít taste has it smells.

1pt 6fl oz bottle. Pours black with a two finger tan head. Heavy aromas of dark coffee, cocoa, light burnt sugar, molasses, and faint dried fruit. Taste wise, lightly sweet with dark coffee, molasses, light ash, and light citrus that leads into BIG roasty malt notes, espresso, medium bitterness, and a light citrus note that leads into a long dry finish. 355ml bottle. pours a very dark black with brown head that disappears rapidly. aroma is coffee, roasted malts, cocoa. quite a thick mouth feel. really nice and smooth. nice mild coffee with a slightly bitter cocoa finish.

355ml bottle. Black pout, tan head. Like pretty uch any rogue beer it looks nice. Aroma is herbal with some roasted notes. Flavor is similiar, with a smooth oat delivery and a hint of fruitiness. Pretty nice.
12 oz bottle. Black color with thin beige head. Roasted coffee aroma. Coffee and chocolate taste. Pretty good stout.

Pours a black with a medium khaki head that left moderate lacing around the glass.The aroma was most coffee and dark roasted malts and bitter chocolate. The taste is very similar but with a little bit of a bitterness to it.

Bottle from Katsuragawa Aeon. Deep black, small tan head that lasts. Huge malty chocolate aroma, just enough smoke. Incredibly smooth, but not too heavy and rich. First oatmeal stout I¬íve had, well impressed.

What a piece of work is this ale. How black in color, how complex in maltiness. In flavor and mouthfeel, how rich and smooth. In hoppiness how like an IPA, in balance how like a stout. A beauty of the style. The paragon of dark brews. And yet, to me, what is this quintessence of grain?
Thus concludes today¬ís bastardization of Shakespeare¬ís Hamlet for the sake of beer. Tune in next week for more Shakesbeerian readings.

22oz bottle in pint glass. Pitch black (no light passed) with 2 fingers light brown foam (medium persistence). Aroma is hoppy with notes of coffee, roasted malts, Chocolate. Pretty light. 355ml bottle at home, forget where from. Pours black, 1cm tan head that is hanging around really well, looks lovely. Aromas are coffee and oatmeal, burnt toast, dark chocolate. Taste brings a sweet prune note to the coffee and chocolate, more oats, light lingering roasted bitterness. Enjoyed this.

Pours a dark brown with a dark khaki head. Aromas of chocolate and coffee. With a slight vanilla aroma. Taste of chocolate and slight smokeyness. Medium mouth feel. Overall very nice beer especially for the price.

On tap, Luppolo12, Rome. Black, small beige head. Aroma caramel, malt. Relatively lighter body for a stout. Taste coffee, chicory. Highly drinkable.

DATE TASTED: November 5, 2014... GLASSWARE: Guinness pint... OCCASION: Teacher Convention weekend begins... APPEARANCE: jet black body; thick, creamy head; thick brown coating as the glass drains; a tragedy, as the glass drains... AROMA: intriguing grainy notes with a lactic quality framing them; some chocolate and bread round out the profile... PALATE: creamy yet strong in its backbone; smooth, medium-bodied and drinkable....TASTE: intense, sweet, milky flavor that also presents some briny qualities; secondary hints of chocolate and some smoke make for a complex finish... OVERALL: a completely wonderful drinking experience--hearty, hardy and warming with an excellent edge...worth the price, though? not far off...

Keg at Rogue, PDX, 12/11/14. Last beer in OR on this trip!
Dark mahogany brown with a decent light tan covering that retains well.

text: Bottle at home. Black with a thin tan head. Rich chocolate malt with a nutty taste. Perfect sweet bitter balance and long finish. Lovely.
This is an absolutely beautiful beer, with a dark brown color and a creamy head. I found this to be a very pleasant and easy to drink beer.
chocolate, licorice aromas from a pitch black body, no head. strong whiskey chocolate with sweet powdery choc finish.

Let¬ís start with this: this beer is not my favorite if we are talking stout in here. The beer is pitch black with medium carbonation/medium head. The aroma is on the milk chocolate side without the buttery factor that usualy indicates that you¬íre about to dive into a rich beer. In fact this beer has a very light body to it and you can¬ít feel the 6% ABV at all. Very well balanced, but yet to light for me palate.

From the bottle. Pours very dark brown, some head with lacing. Smells of sour, chocolate, molasses. Taste is creamy with notes of chocolate and molasses. Finishes a little sour, lingering aftertaste.

Malty with subtle hoppy flavor. Notes of coffee and dark chocolate. Full taste without being really heavy.

Bottle. Black. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee grind, and roasted malt. The taste adds some hoppy bitterness. The mouthfeel highlights the oatmeal by starting thin and expanding to a thicker creamy texture. Carb is on the lively side with a rich finish. Damn good all around.

I have had this bottled and on nitro. This is hands down my favorite stout and I have had far more than my current ratings show. This beer has a roasted chocolate aroma that follows in flavor leading into notes of coffee and more roasted chocolate. This is well hopped in perfect balance with the roasty bitterness smoothed out by the oats. The perfect stout.
Pours a dark brown, almost black color with a rich brown head. Nice toasted malt flavor with a bit of chocolate. Aroma matches. Seemed a bit thin to me.
Poured from a bottle. Large Brown head that dissipates quickly, but a good lacing. Rich black color. Chocolate and oatmeal aroma. Delicious going down, deserves it¬ís high rating.
Very dark pour from the bomber almost black with a small head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel and some roasted malts. Taste has some smokiness with some tropical dark fruits and cocoa. Smooth finish.

4.1 bottle, 4.3 nitro tap

Bottle (12oz $2.30): Pours nearly black with nice tan head. Some oatmeal and a little chocolate in the taste followed by quite a bit of bitterness that lingers. I prefer less bitterness in a stout but still nice.
Bottle. Black with a thin tan head. Aroma is oat, roasted malt and chocolate. Taste follows closely. Medium creamy mouthfeel and light carb. Nice.
Bottle, thx vaiz. Aroma is mocca, chocolate, roast, hint of cardboard, light liquorice and some red fruits. . Flavour is roasty mocca molasses with liquorice and some roasty bitterness. Nice.
Bottle at home. Black pour, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, molasses, soy sauce and caramel. Flavor is quite bitter, thick roasted malts and quite dry. Nice thick body.
Bottle. Roasty malts and plums on the nose. Nice thick bodied mouth feel. Bits of chocolate and coffee with a citrusy hop finish. Excellent beer
Love it, thick and wonderful. Think of dark secluded alleyway filled with secret hidden dark mystic evil excellence.

Deep brown black pour. Nose of acidic roasted malt and toast with mild dark fruit. Flavor is roasted malt with toasted oat and moderate hop bitterness. Lingering acidic roast and mild coffee with hops.
Poors black, no head. Sweet earthy with strong hints of bitter chocolate and coffee undertones. Finishes with bitter chocolate.

650mL bottle
Near flawless jet black body with a dense, well-sized pale brown head holding.
Excellent intensity on the nose; dark chocolate, baked cookies, porridge (in a good way, if that¬ís possible!?), soy sauce, orange & citrus, and woody hops.
Moderate carbonation, creamy texture with a full body.
Bit less intense on the body, but still plenty to enjoy; chocolate, caramel, orange, pine, dried leaves, touch of bread. Moderate bitterness on a medium-dry finish.
Really good stuff, sets the bar high for the Oatmeal stout!

Dry oatmeal stout with yellowish beige head and very dark brown, almost black colour. Strong coffee-like roasted malts in the nose, raisins, bitter chocolate, leather, tonic water, bayleaf... Taste roasted bitter from beginning to end, very full, creamy and oily mouthfeel, chocolate, dried plums, with a strong citrussy hop bitterness coming up in the end - too strong for this style, if you ask me. Otherwise very interesting, though.

Nice very dark brown body with modest but solid head. Aroma is heavy on the hoppiness, I¬íd prefer some more barley to shine through to remind me it¬ís a stout. Flavour is strong on the hoppiness with a hint of chocolate, some coffee. But those hops, they drown a lot of the nuance out. This was sampled at room temperature, perhaps with some chillin¬í there would be less illin¬í.
dark colour with good roasty coffee aroma,medium body smooth among little sweet chocolate some bitterness finish great!

Bottle. Pours a solid black color with a tan head and good lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, bit of oatmeal and fresh grains. Taste of roasted malts, dark chocolate and oatmeal. Distinct bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, rich and creamy texture, with lots of character. This beer sets the bar for others to be compared to.
Chocolate cereals. Roasted malt, vanilla, coffee beans, bitter finish. Quite a strong bitter stout for a Rogue, rich roasted flavors but didn¬ít really do it for me.
Pours jet black with off-white head. Bitter, roasted cocoa beans on the nose. Oak, vanilla, cocoa, hints of chocolate, slightly bready, nice malty sweetness. A delicious stout.

I don¬ít see a date on the bottle, but the hops are still sharp. It pours like motor oil, and has no light penetration. It smells like a bitter espresso, with some nice malty sweetness in there. It has a bite of hop bitterness on the front of the mouth. Day-old, bitter coffee taste dominates. It gives a medium mouth-feel; very creamy and smooth. It finishes bitter, with lingering coffee bitterness. The hops are noticeable on the finish, adding to the dry, clean finish. This Rogue is well worth the try!

Pours an opaque black with a big creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, light piney hops and cream. Taste is chocolate, roasted malt with some bite, cocoa and a bit of piney hop flavor. Finishes dry with a nice crisp bitterness from the roasted malts.. Excellent oatmeal stout!

Smells like oatmeal. Pours pitch black with a lot of brown foamy head from bottle. Mouth feel is pretty smooth with just a little carbonation at the end. The taste is very oatmeal like with a good deal of maltiness. Some of the oatmeal sits on the tongue at the end.

Poured opaque black with a 2-finger dark tan head. Aroma of bitter chocolate with a light grainy note. Full body, lightly oily with a soft finish. Flavor of chocolate with a mild burnt note underneath and a grainy note in the finish.

Lovely black pour w/ a big mocha head that leaves a bit of lacing. The aroma has some nice chocolate notes w/ a hint of some roasted bitterness. The taste is richly full of chocolate upfront & finishes slightly thin w/ some bitterness. This is another fine offering from rogue!

Aroma of chicory and coffee, ebony colour with a lasting well laced brown head. Taste of espresso and chocolate with a watery feel and a mildly bitter palate.

Buona rappresentazione di una classica stout. Colore nero impenetrabile e schiuma abbondante e persistente, dal colore un po¬í pi√π chiaro di quello di un cappuccino. Al naso si percepiscono chiaramente le classiche note tostate. Non va bevuta appena tolta dal frigo, si percepisce quasi esclusivamente solo l¬íamaro. Dopo, in bocca, si avvertiranno meglio le note chiarissime di caff√® e cacao amaro, con un retrogusto amaro inaspettatamente poco accentuato e che non persiste molto dopo la fine della bevuta. A black beer with a small brown head. The aroma is roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, and nutty. The flavor is bittersweet chocolate, smoky roasted malt, and creamy oats.
Pours very dark, almost black. Chocolate and coffee aromas and flavors. Tastes too much like coffee for my taste

Very dark borwn body, light brown head. Really nice bittersweet aroma heavy on chocolate, with vanlilla, coffee, hints of wood and smoke. Smooth, heavy palate. Balanced flavour with chocolate, a light bitterness with coffee and a dry oatmeal aftertaste.

I love this and for me within the style it is a winner. Pours lovely and the aroma hits you as it pours into the glass. Lovely aftertaste and it lingers. As I said before when Rogue do it right they nail it and they have nailed it here.

On tap at Saturday market. Love the dark body and creamy brown head. Chocolate is super prevalent here, starts and finishes with it. The cascade hops finish nice at the end with the chocolate. The Oatmeal gives nice viscosity to the body
A bit disappointed with this one. Attractive black body with brown head. Roasty lactose aroma. Taste is roasted malts coffee. Overall not very complex but decent. A notch better than a Guinness.
Bottle. Nearly black pour with a nice mocha head. Chocolate, coffee, very roasty with hints of vanilla and smoke. A really great stout.

Transfer from BA review from 6-10-12- 
Served on nitro-tap in a tulip shaped glass

Appearance ¬ñ Served a nearly pitch black color with a wonderful thick light brown nitrogen formed head. The head was very persistent and lasted the entire drinking experience.

Smell ¬ñ The aroma was of roasted malt and cocoa with a sugary sweetness. The sweet aromas were hard to plac,e but seemed to be mainly of molasses and brown sugar . Mixed with these was a light burnt smell that overall created a nice balance to the sweet aromas of the sugar.

Taste ¬ñ The taste started out of roasted malt and a lighter oat flavor. The cocoa that was detected in the nose quickly came to the tongue. It started out sweet when it arrived due to a nice molasses sweetness the accompanied its arrival, but the molasses started to fade more toward the middle of the taste as some roasted coffee flavors began to develop. These bittered the brew a bit and left a nice, more dry, roasted and cocoa flavor on the tongue.

Mouthfeel ¬ñ The creamy nitrogen driven body coated the mouth, bathing it in all the wonderful flavors of the brew. Being a nitro the effervescence was lighter, this accentuating all those wonderfully slightly sweet dark and roasty flavors.

Overall ¬ñ This was one fine tasty beer. The nitro pour suited all the darker roasted flavors very well giving an overall creamy and satisfying brew.

Un liquide riche, aux allures de p√©trole brut, aux relents choco-caf√©in√©s, √† la mousse style crema. On constate en bouche que le m√©lange, loin de n¬í√™tre qu¬íune simple orgie malt√©e, est tout √† fait bien balanc√©e entre ses diverses caract√©ristiques, tout en enrobant g√©n√©reusement le palais. Un stout comme il doit √™tre : riche, touffu, bourr√© de saveur jusqu¬í√† la derni√®re goutte. Classique, et tr√®s r√©ussi.

Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours black to brown with a beige to brown head, aroma of chocolate, Oatmeal, vanilla and roasted malt, flavor of roasted cocoa, coffee and oatmeal, medium bodied.

I poured this into a nonic pint glass.
The appearance was a decent looking black color with a nice looking off white foamy three finger head. The lacing is fairly thick and sticks finely to the glass.
The smell was semi-roasty and coffee-like but as it warmed there was some oatmeal like features.
The taste was mainly roasty but had a decent sweetness running about it. The aftertaste did end up having a decent light chocolate about it. The finish was super dry.
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium in body and had a decent sessionability about it.
Overall, for the most part, this is a decent oatmeal stout worthy of having again.

At a tasting, thanks zvikar, small creamy bubbly head, very dark brown almost black colour, aroma of highly roasted coffee, charred wood and some soy, flavour of coffee, dirt and dark chocolate, mellow pleasant bitterness and light sweetness. Nice and enjoyable.
Draft @Culinary Dropout. $17 for a small glass too much. Good dry stout, light body with lots of character. Smoke, wood, tabaco flavors. Food Pairing: Oysters!

medium black pour..slight mocha color head..nose is chocolate..oats..cold press coffee..mouthfeel is smooth, slightly creamy with a solid stout presence..however left a bit of a lingering aftertaste/aroma of bandaid that I didn¬ít really care for..overall a decent beer that I can recall having years and years back in a bomber and being much more impressed with...
Roasted malts, chocolate and some smoke on the nose. Creamy with a bitter finish. Taste is sweet chocolate, espresso with a citrus hop finish.

Pours black with a thick beige head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate and some aromatic hops, quite unusual for a stout. Taste is similar, lots of roasted flavors. Good dry finish, medium bitterness.
Pour pitch black with a frothy head. Rich note of roasted malt mixed with a hint of hop in aroma. Smooth, lingering mid bitterness finish. A well balanced stout if not a bit too light.

Teku/nonic glass. Pitch black with big, mocca, long lasting head. Good lacing.
Medium roasted grains aroma character (partly coffee-like aromas), medium fruity aromas - rasins, plums. Almostly none hop aroma, light oatmeal aroma. Mainly you can smell dark fruits mentioned above, in the second place roasted grains with dominant coffee aroma, than dark chocolate. 
Medium sweet taste. Earthy and grainy steel oat flavour. Strong character of roasted malts. Sometimes it tastes like coffee with cream or milk. In the end the coffee flavor is really dominant. Low bitterness somewhere in the end. Aftertaste is mild coffee-bitter. Medium-full body, silky and very smooth, almost light oily. Medium carbonation. Finishing is bitter and dry.
650 ml bottle. Black with small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Flavor is slightly sweet with notes of coffee and a dry, bitter chocolate finish.

On tap poured into an 8oz shaker. A big coffee aroma with a chocolate touch is notable right from the start. Underneath that, there¬ís a grain and/or oat, dry aroma with a bit of pine. The color is a rich, syrupy, near opaque brown - black topped by a light, micro bubble, light brown head. A okay ring is retained with a very light, wispy layer. No lace is left on this one. The taste is a medium - high sweetness with a medium bitter quality near the end. The syrupy, viscous texture has very little, flat carbonation with a big, full malt body. The finish is a combination of dark chocolate, oats and grains, and leftover brewed coffee with maybe even a bit of a nuttiness. The aftertaste is burnt toast and oats with chocolate syrup; it¬ís also a bit resinous.

Black color. Medium persistent brown colored foam collar. Aromas of coffee, roast, oat and hops. Flavors of roasted malt, oat and resinous and bitter hops. 
Couleur noire. Moyen col de mousse tint√©e qui persiste. Ar√¥mes de caf√©, torr√©faction, avoine et houblons. Saveurs de malt torr√©fi√©, avoine et houblons r√©sineux et am√®re.
Great dark color, had this on nitro. Coffee, dark chocolate tastes, clean and smooth.

Bottle from the Hunger Mountain Coop in Vermont. Pours a real dark brown colour with hardly any highlights. Mocha brown coloured head, great retention and sticky lacing. Roasted malt aromas with lots of fruity notes from the malt. Hints of coffee, also found in the taste a little more. Takes over the fruitiness of the malt. Coffee lingers in the after taste with a little dryness from the hops, creating some mild bitterness. A nice beer but seems to me more like a regular porter than an oatmeal stout. Missing the creaminess and sweetness of one. Love Rogue, but not impressed with this one.
inky black. frothy head. smooth slick mouthfeel. low carbonation. pretty meaty. slight bitterness, dries out tongue.

Inky black pour with a thick tan head. Rich nose of earthy chocolate and steel cut oats with a dry roastiness. Nice creamy and rich flavor that isnt too heavy or syrupy. Nice sweet earthy roast tones with some cocoa and earthy oat, with a smoky finish.
Dry, hints of chocolate, not the smooth silky mouthfeel I¬íd expect, mild bitterness overpowers malty sweetness. I fear this hasn¬ít been stored properly and may be a disservice to the brewers.
Amazing pour with a finger of tan head. Aroma of chocolate, malts, and slight bitter bakers chocolate. Taste is medium sweet with a bitter oily finish. Amazing stout

Ar: Sweet coffee and caramel - mild citrusy hops - dark chocolate.
Ap: Deep brown with black center, opaque - small light mocha head with poor retention, leaves a thin ring and a wisp of foam on top.
T: Mildly sweet cocoa - light roast coffee - high bitterness, hops have a herbal, slightly piney flavor - char and roasted caramel, slight soy.
P: Medium body with high carbonation - slightly oily - finish is dry.
O: Solid stout - lots of chocolate and coffee flavor with a firm bitterness and some pine and citrus hop accents.
An excellent oatmeal stout, well balanced with a good combination of hops and malt. Pleasing in appearance and pours with a well defined head.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a dark dark brown with tan head. Aroma of coffee. Taste of coffee with hints of dark chocolate.

1 pint bottle. Not a bad stout, but has a little after taste. I probably wouldnt buy it again.

Bomber into an English pint. Pours jet black with a half-inch tan head. Nose of roasted malts with a bit of coffee and moderate hoppy presence; rich roasty flavour with a bit of chocolate malt, light hop, bitter finish. Creamy and velvety on the palate. Delightful.

Great beer! Lots of hoppiness for a porter, great balance of hops and malt! Well done!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.

A- Cocoa, malty, chocolate, roasty.

A- Black color, black liquid, tan head.

T- Cocoa, chocolate, coffee, oats, malty, slightly bitter.

P- Medium body, thin texture, average carbonation, malty dry finish.

O- A good stout, but a little thin on the body. The oatmeal made this really smooth and there was solid chocolate creamy flavors. Good, but just not quite full or rich enough for me.

Dark brown pour with frothy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, rolled oats. Taste of roasted malts, unsweetened chocolate, hint of coffee, oats and faint lactose. Medium bodied, nice carbonation, soft mouthfeel, slightly bitter finish. Very good oatmeal stout.

Pours in black body with frosty brown head, quickly disspearing. Aroma has roasty, light chocolate notes, light vanilla. Taste is light roasty sweetness, medium noble bitterness. Body us light, medium carbonation. Not sure why so overrated, palate is far from complex, body just light.

Amazing stout, rich, creamy, and thick. Hints of nuts, grains and roasted coffee. If you like Stouts and Porters, you're gonna love this. If you want to share, buy a couple bottles because you're gonna want to drink a bottle to yourself!

Bottle. Pours black with a decent head, nice lacing. In aroma mainly roasted, coffee notes with a hints of hops. In taste coffee, dark chocolate, more hoppy notes than in the aroma. Medium bodied, medium, soft carbonation, bitter aftertaste. Very good stout.

22oz bomber from Lacey Liquors. Pours pitch black with a small creamy mocha head. Aroma of cocoa powder, coffee, burnt malts, caramel, and some alcohol. Taste of ash, dark chocolate, burnt coffee, and some caramel in the aftertaste.
Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are chocolate, coffee, and some malty sweetness.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Bottle: Jet black, no color, topped with a huge, dark-tan head made of fine bubbles that lasts for seemingly days; chunky lacing left behind. Aroma full of sweetness & roasted grains... small dose of ashy, leafy hops bite the nostrils. Light cocoa powder, smooth cut oats, & a current of creamy sweetness that ties everything together. Deep, robust flavor of heavily roasted malts, nuts, wood, bittersweet cocoa nibs & cocoa powder, & a hint of bitter espresso bean on the very back end. Strong hop presence; earthy, leafy, mildly floral, acting as a good malt offset. Nice creaminess from the oats, which are flavorful in the aftertaste. Lasting, lightly hop-bitter, earthy-cocoa finish. Might be the best beer I¬íve had from Rogue.
Bottle->snifter. Black with small lite brown head. A: coffee, chocolate, malt, toffee. Rich. T: same, with pronounced chocolate malt. Deep and good.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2014 Always a good choice. Roasted dark chocolate, light coffee, cream and toasted oats. Not the most complex flavors, but great flavors nonetheless.
